CatDescriptText: Mrs. Juanita Toney, housewife, 7016 Upland Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I believe that most people follow the leadership of the church.  Why, I really can't say at this moment."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Juanita Toney wearing basket weave patterned coat, eyeglasses, and round ribbed earrings, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Thrift Drugs and Kappels stores in background, Downtown
